rdevdash 0.1.0.9000
  • Reference

    Server logic for the Shiny application

    app_server.Rd

    This function defines the server-side logic of the Shiny application. It handles user inputs, processes data, and updates outputs accordingly. The server function sets up reactive expressions, observers, and render functions to interact with the UI components.

    app_server(input, output, session)

    Arguments

    input

    Shiny input object containing input values from the UI.

    output

    Shiny output object used to send output to the UI.

    session

    Shiny session object.

    Value

    None. This function is called for its side effects of setting up the server logic of the Shiny app.

    Details

    The server function performs several key operations:

    Package Validation

    Validates the selected package name and checks if it is a valid CRAN package.

    Version Handling

    Retrieves package versions and updates version selection inputs in the UI.

    NEWS Diff Tab

    Fetches the NEWS file for the package and displays the differences between versions.

    Downloads Tab

    Plots the download statistics of the package over time.

    Checkpage Tab

    Displays CRAN check results and package status.

    Release List Tab

    Shows the list of package releases with details.

    Dependencies Tab

    Displays user and developer dependencies of the package.

    Info Tab

    Provides package information such as title, description, version, license, etc.

    Contents

    Developed by Maciej Nasinski.
